MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the
ability, experience, education, and training to perform the
duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Community Care Organization (CCO) failed Independent Living
Youth A (ILY A) on several occasions. The court has ordered
CCO to provide many services for her including but not limited to
parenting classes maternity clothes, etc. These things were
ordered on court orders dated 8/8/22, 11/10/22, 12/11/22. CCO
was irate with the Referee, GAL, and ILY A at the hearing on
12/8/22.
Investigation The reporting source for this investigation was not interviewed due
to the complaint being received as anonymous. The allegation
states that Community Care Organization (CCO) failed ILY A on
several occasions. The court has ordered CCO to provide many
services for her including but not limited to parenting classes,
maternity clothes, etc. These things were ordered on court orders
dated 8/8/22, 11/10/22, 12/11/22. CCO was irate with the
Referee, GAL, and ILY A at the hearing on 12/8/22.
2

Independent Living Youth A (ILY A) was interviewed on
01/11/2023 via telephone. Several attempts were set to go to her
home address but due to COVID symptoms, no in person contact
was made prior to this telephone interview. ILY A reported she
had no idea who made this complaint because she never said she
did not receive any support or assistance from Community Care
Organization. She said she was angry because she could not get
her check direct deposited when she was in their independent
living program, and she did not get her clothing order. She said
this took a long time, but she has received her clothing order since
being placed with her current agency. She did not disclose
additional information. She said she and her newborn baby are
doing well in her current placement.
The Program Manager was interviewed on 12/19/2022. She
reported that ILY A’s assigned caseworker completed a face-to-
face visit with ILY A in April 2022. The Program Manager reported
that ILY A wanted to have her check direct deposited and she said
she was in need of a clothing order due to being pregnant. She
said ILY A was provided with information on parenting classes.
She said on July 26, 2022, ILY A was provided information on a
mother-baby program. The Program Manager reported a clothing
voucher was submitted to DHHS for ILY A on 10/13/2022. She
said additional resources were provided to ILY A on 11/09/2022.
She said her agency purchased ILY A a Pack and Play, a car
seat, and changing table that cost $499.00. The Program
Manager identified several referral forms that were presented to
ILY A that were in ILY A’s case record for review. These forms
were, “Foster Youth to Independence Initiative (Tenant Protection
Voucher)”, Free Diaper Distribution Program, and a mother-baby
program that is provided for teens up to 25 years old. This
program includes feminine products, diapers and pull ups, wipes,
formula, baby food, new and gently used clothing, shoes, car
seats and stroller. All of these resources were in ILY A’s case
record with documentation that she was provided the resources.
The Program Manager reported she submitted a clothing order for
ILY A on 10/13/2022. She reported she received a payment from
MDHHS in January of 2023. The Program Manager said she
forwarded the check to Children Center per DHHS request.
The Caseworker assigned to ILY A was interviewed during
the time of this onsite visit 12/19/2022. She agreed with the
Program Manager and did not add any additional information.
She stressed that Community Care Organization provided ILY A
3

with resource information for housing and additional information
needed per court order.
Caseworker from ILY A’s current agency was interviewed on
01/03/2023. She reported that ILY A entered the
Young Adult Self Sufficiency program on 12/15/2022. She said
she retrieved numerous items on 01/09/2023 from ILY A’s CASA
worker’s office. The items included: baby pack and play, baby
swing, baby clothes, and receiving blankets. The case worker said
she brought ILY A two packs of baby diapers on 01/12/2023,
provided by their agency boutique. She said ILY A’s only
complaint was that she is frustrated that she has yet to receive her
clothing voucher which was submitted through Community Care
Organization and a delay in her government stipend. The
Caseworker said she followed up with the MDHHS monitor on
02/03/2023 regarding the clothing voucher submitted and was
informed that the voucher was made out to Community Care
Organization, and she had to make adjustments so that the
voucher would be made to the current agency for ILY A. The
Caseworker said ILY A currently has no concerns.
Documents reviewed:
Court Order dated 08/03/2022. This order states, “Child in SIL
placement with paternal aunt and doing well. Youth is pregnant.
Court orders prenatal services and maternity clothes, baby
supplies, and baby clothing will be supplied. Worker will assist
with YVAC application and applying for section 8 housing.”
Updated Service Plan dated 08/25/2022 -11/22/2022,
documented the following social work contacts regarding
resources:
10/04/2022 – Housing document completed.
10/06/2022 – Housing and clothing checklist completed.
11/17/2022 – Discuss needs for unborn baby and the resources
available. Provided pamphlets.
12/19/2022 – Review personnel files of the Program Manager and
Caseworker.
Analysis ILY A had no complaints against Community Care Organization
for not receiving resources other than not getting her clothing
order timely. During her transition from Community Care
Organization to her current location, the clothing order had to be
resubmitted and changed to the current agency. Her clothing
order initially went to Community Care Organization, while she
had relocated to a different agency which delayed her clothing
order.
4

ILY A’s current caseworker reported she has no complaints and is
doing well with their agency.
The Program Manager and the Caseworker at Community Care
Organization provided documentation showing where they shared
resources with ILY A. ILY A emails were reviewed showing she
received resource information per the court orders.
Both the Program Manager and the Caseworker has the
experience, ability, and education requirements to perform the
duties assigned.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12507 Medical/dental and mental health care.
Section (1) An agency shall ensure that a youth in independent living
Description receives any needed medical, dental, and mental health
care as required I R400.12413. Medical, dental, and
mental health care provided shall be documented in the
youth’s record.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Community Care Organization (CCO) failed Independent Living
Youth A (ILY A) on several occasions. The court has ordered CCO
to provide many services for her including but not limited to
parenting classes maternity clothes, etc. These things were
ordered on court orders dated 8/8/22, 11/10/22, 12/11/22. CCO
was irate with the Referee, GAL, and ILY A at the hearing on
12/8/22.
Investigation The Program Manager was interviewed on 12/19/2022. She
reported that ILY A’s assigned caseworker completed a face-to-
face visit with ILY A in April 2022 and found out that ILY A said
she was not feeling well and that she went to the hospital
emergency and found out that she was six weeks pregnant. She
said ILY A was provided with information on parenting classes and
mother baby programs.
The Program Manager showed several emails from the
Caseworker and ILY A regarding doctor’s appointments. A doctor
appointment was held on 12/09/2022. Ultrasound pictures were
observed in the case record. ILY A was also attending prenatal
baby appointments.
5

The Program Manager reported her agency purchased ILY A a
Pack and Play, a car seat, and changing table that cost $499.00.
The Program Manager identified several referral forms that were
presented to ILY A that were in ILY A’s case record for review
regarding medical appointments.
Court Order dated 08/03/2022. This order states, “Child in SIL
placement with paternal aunt and doing well. Youth is pregnant.
Court orders prenatal services and maternity clothes, baby
supplies, and baby clothing will be supplied.
Updated Service Plan dated 08/25/2022 -11/22/2022 and
11/23/2022 -1/14/2023 documented ILY A’s doctor’s appointments
in the social work contacts.
Analysis ILY A medical and health care needs were being met while in
Community Care Organization. There were also ultrasound
pictures observed in ILY A’s case record confirming prenatal visits.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
03/22/2023

Pinkey Brown Date
